name: Lowlight
tagline: A simple syntax highlighter in Common Lisp
body: # lowlight A simple, regex based syntax highlighter in Common Lisp. ## Features * higlighting code in html spans * themable with css * string and file highlighting * simple and flexible highlighting engine * based on regular expressions ### Supported languages * Common Lisp The Common Lisp style tries to emulate SLIME but sometimes offers more classes. For an example look [here](example.html), the corresponding CSS is [here](example.css). I will probably support more languages in the future, but you can also define your own language styles. Also, patches to get your language style included are welcome. ## Installation ASDF, hopefully Quicklisp in the future. ## Usage For detailed documentation go [here](lowlight.html). All lowlight functions and macros live in the package `lowlight` ```common-lisp (in-package #:lowlight) ``` To highlight a string use `light` ```common-lisp (light :common-lisp ":bla") ;=> ":bla" ``` If you want to highlight a whole file, use `light-file` ```common-lisp (light-file :common-lisp "~/lowlight.lisp" :css "github-colors.css") ```
